function.name: OpenWeatherMap.get_current_weather
function.description: Fetches the current weather information for a specified location using the OpenWeatherMap API.

location.description: The location for which current weather information is requested, specified in the format of 'City, Country' in English. For example: 'Seoul, South Korea'.

units.description: The unit system used for the weather data. Can be 'metric' for Celsius, 'imperial' for Fahrenheit, or 'standard' for Kelvin.

api_key.description: The API key used to authenticate requests to the OpenWeatherMap API. This key should be kept secret.

function.name: ControlAppliance.execute
function.description: This function is designed for controlling a home appliance, checking its current status and settings, as well as monitoring indoor air properties like air quality and temperature. For control commands, the input must clearly specify 'power on' or 'start'. To check the status, the input must include the keyword '확인'. Note that this tool is not intended for describing, creating, deleting, or removing modes or routines.

command.description: The command must be specified as a string in Korean, consisting of the room name, appliance name (or alias), and operation command, separated by commas. Examples: '거실, 에어컨, 실행' for turning on the air conditioner in the living room, ', 에어컨, 냉방 실행' for activating cooling without specifying the room, '다용도실, 통돌이, 중지' for stopping the washing machine (alias '통돌이') in the utility room.

keyword.description: The search term used by the HNA WQA to find relevant information on the web.

result_format.description: The desired format of the search results.

language.description: The language preference for the search results.

max_results.description: Maximum number of search results to return.

keyword.description: The key term used to search for relevant news articles.

date_range.description: The date range for the news search, formatted as 'YYYY-MM-DD to YYYY-MM-DD'.

sort_by.description: The sorting order of the search results.

language.description: The language of the news articles to retrieve.

keyword.description: The keyword to search for in the recipe titles or ingredients.

max_results.description: The maximum number of recipe results to return.

function.name: send_message
function.description: Sends a personalized message to a human user, including support for Unicode characters such as emojis.

message.description: The content of the message to be sent to the user. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis.

recipient.description: The identifier of the message recipient, such as an email address or a phone number, in the format 'name@example.com' or '+12345678900'.

priority.description: The priority level of the message.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the message should be sent, formatted as 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' in UTC. If not specified, the message will be sent immediately.

function.name: pause_heartbeats
function.description: Temporarily suspends the processing of timed heartbeats for a specified duration. Manual heartbeats and other event processing will continue as normal.

minutes.description: The duration in minutes for which heartbeats should be ignored. Must be a positive integer and less than or equal to 3600 minutes (equivalent to 60 hours).

include_manual.description: A flag to determine if manual heartbeats should also be ignored. By default, only timed heartbeats are paused.

function.name: message_chatgpt
function.description: Sends a message to ChatGPT, a basic AI model, designed to respond to queries without retaining memory of prior interactions. Useful for one-time questions and instructions.

message.description: The message to be sent to ChatGPT. It should be a well-formed English sentence.

request_heartbeat.description: Determines whether an immediate heartbeat is requested post-execution, facilitating subsequent messages or functions. When true, it implies readiness for further interaction.

function.name: core_memory_append
function.description: Appends a specified content to a section of the core memory. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis.

name.description: The section of the memory to be edited. Valid sections are 'persona' for character traits and 'human' for human-like experiences.

content.description: The content to append to the memory. Can include any Unicode character, such as text and emojis.

request_heartbeat.description: If true, requests an immediate heartbeat to verify the memory update. Useful for confirming that subsequent messages or functions are executed in response to the update.

function.name: core_memory_replace
function.description: Replaces the contents of a specific section in the core memory. To delete specific memories, provide an empty string for the new_content parameter.

name.description: The section of the memory to be edited. Possible sections include 'persona' or 'human'.

old_content.description: The string to be replaced. This must be an exact match of the memory content to be replaced.

new_content.description: The new content to write into the memory. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis. Use an empty string ('') to signify memory deletion.

request_heartbeat.description: Requests an immediate heartbeat after the function execution. Set to true to ensure the system is responsive for follow-up actions.

function.name: recall_memory_search
function.description: Search the conversation history for a specific string and return the matching results. This can be used to reference past conversations or retrieve information previously discussed.

query.description: The keyword or phrase to search within the conversation history.

page.description: Defines the page number of the search results to return, allowing pagination through a large set of results. The first page is 0.

request_heartbeat.description: When set to true, triggers an immediate heartbeat after the search function completes. Useful for initiating follow-up actions or checks.

function.name: archival_memory_insert
function.description: This function adds a new entry to the archival memory, ensuring the content is formatted in a manner conducive to future queries and retrievals.

content.description: The information to be archived. Accepts any unicode text, including emojis. Format the content clearly to aid in effective querying.

request_heartbeat.description: When set to true, triggers an immediate heartbeat to confirm successful execution. Useful for initiating follow-up actions.

function.name: archival_memory_search
function.description: Performs a semantic search on archival memory data, utilizing embeddings to find relevant content based on the provided query string.

query.description: The search phrase used to query the archival memory. It should be a coherent string of text.

page.description: Specifies the page number in the search result pagination. It is zero-indexed, where 0 represents the first page.

request_heartbeat.description: Determines whether to request an immediate heartbeat after function execution, useful for initiating a follow-up action.

function.name: http_request
function.description: Generates an HTTP request of a specified type to the provided URL, including an optional payload, and returns the response.

method.description: The HTTP method to be used for the request.

url.description: The target URL for the HTTP request.

payload_json.description: A JSON-formatted string representing the request payload. This should be in a proper JSON structure, encoded as a string.

request_heartbeat.description: If set to true, signals that an immediate heartbeat should be requested after the function's execution. Useful for confirming connectivity or the successful completion of the request.

headers.description: Optional headers to be included in the HTTP request. Common headers include 'Content-Type' and 'Authorization'.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the request body, typically 'application/json'.

Authorization.description: Authentication credentials for the request, such as 'Bearer <token>' or 'Basic <credentials>'.

event_type.description: The type of cultural event to find. Possible values are 'Music' for concerts and 'Theater' for plays.

city.description: The city where the event is taking place, in the format of 'City, State' (e.g., 'New York, NY').

date.description: The date of the event in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. If not specified, the function will search for events regardless of date.

function.name: Events_3_BuyEventTickets
function.description: Facilitates the purchase of tickets for a cultural event on a specific date in a designated city.

event_name.description: The name of the artist or the title of the play for which tickets are being purchased.

number_of_tickets.description: The quantity of tickets to be reserved for the event.

date.description: The scheduled date of the event, in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

city.description: The city where the event is located, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Berkeley, CA' and 'New York, NY'.

explanation: The user prompt clearly specifies all required parameters: restaurant name ('The French Laundry'), location ('Yountville, CA'), time ('13:30'), date ('2023-03-14'), and number of seats ('4 people'). There is a single, unambiguous function call that can answer the user's query: Restaurants_2_ReserveRestaurant('The French Laundry', 'Yountville, CA', '13:30', '2023-03-14', 4). The function documentation and parameters are clear and provide the necessary format for inputs. Hence, no human re-evaluation is necessary.

question.content: Hi there, could you get me a table at The French Laundry in Yountville, CA on the 14th of March 2023 at 13:30 for 4 people please?

function.name: Restaurants_2_ReserveRestaurant
function.description: Make a table reservation at a specified restaurant on a given date and time for a certain number of guests.

restaurant_name.description: The name of the restaurant where the table reservation will be made.

location.description: The city where the restaurant is located, in the format of 'City, State' (e.g., 'New York, NY').

time.description: The tentative time for the restaurant reservation, in 24-hour format 'HH:MM' (e.g., '19:00' for 7 PM).

number_of_seats.description: The number of seats to reserve at the restaurant.

date.description: The tentative date for the restaurant reservation in ISO format 'YYYY-MM-DD' (e.g., '2021-08-15').

function.name: Restaurants_2_FindRestaurants
function.description: Search for restaurants based on their location, category, price range, and availability of vegetarian options and outdoor seating.

category.description: The type of cuisine or food category offered by the restaurant, such as 'Italian', 'Chinese', or 'Vegetarian'.

location.description: The city or location where the restaurant is situated, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'San Francisco, CA'.

price_range.description: The price category of the restaurant. The options range from 'cheap' to 'ultra high-end'.

has_vegetarian_options.description: Indicates if the restaurant offers vegetarian meal options.

has_seating_outdoors.description: Indicates if the restaurant provides seating outdoors.

explanation: The user prompt 'Hi, could you help me search for some nice Supernatural movies please in Berkeley?' is somewhat ambiguous. While the genre 'Supernatural' is clear, the term 'nice' is subjective and the location 'Berkeley' is incomplete as it does not specify the state. However, given common knowledge, one might assume Berkeley, CA. The function description and parameters are relatively clear, but the user prompt lacks specificity in the 'location' parameter. The prompt does not require extensive re-evaluation but does need clarification regarding the state in the location and what is meant by 'nice'.

question.content: Hi, could you help me search for some nice Supernatural movies please in Berkeley?

function.name: Movies_1_BuyMovieTickets
function.description: This function facilitates the purchase of movie tickets for a specified show, allowing for selection of the movie, number of tickets, show date, location, and show type.

movie_name.description: The title of the movie for which tickets are being purchased.

number_of_tickets.description: The total count of tickets to be bought.

show_date.description: The date of the movie showing, in the format of 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

location.description: The location of the theater, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Los Angeles, CA'.

show_time.description: The start time of the movie showing, in 24-hour format 'HH:MM'.

show_type.description: The format in which the movie is being shown.

function.name: Movies_1_FindMovies
function.description: Search for movies based on specific criteria such as location, genre, and show type.

location.description: The city where the theater is located, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Berkeley, CA' or 'New York, NY'.

theater_name.description: The name of the theater. If not provided, all theaters are considered.

show_type.description: The format of the movie show such as regular, 3D, or IMAX.

function.name: Movies_1_GetTimesForMovie
function.description: Retrieve available showtimes for a specific movie at a given theater location on a specified date.

movie_name.description: The title of the movie for which showtimes are being requested.

location.description: The city in which the theater is located, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Berkeley, CA' and 'New York, NY'.

show_date.description: The date for which to retrieve showtimes, in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

theater_name.description: The name of the theater where the movie is showing. If not specified, showtimes for all theaters are considered.

show_type.description: The format of the movie showing, such as 'regular', '3D', or 'IMAX'.

function.name: Restaurants_2_ReserveRestaurant
function.description: Make a table reservation at a specified restaurant for a given number of guests at a particular date and time.

restaurant_name.description: The full name of the restaurant where the reservation is to be made.

location.description: The location of the restaurant, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'New York, NY' or 'San Francisco, CA'.

time.description: The desired time for the reservation, in 24-hour format 'HH:MM', such as '19:00' for 7 PM.

number_of_guests.description: The number of guests for the reservation.

date.description: The date for which the reservation is made, in ISO 8601 format 'YYYY-MM-DD', such as '2023-04-15'.

function.name: Restaurants_2_FindRestaurants
function.description: Find restaurants by location and by category, taking into account optional preferences such as price range, vegetarian options, and outdoor seating availability.

category.description: The category of food offered by the restaurant, such as 'Mexican', 'Italian', or 'Japanese'.

location.description: The location of the restaurant, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'San Francisco, CA'.

price_range.description: The price range for the restaurant, with 'dontcare' indicating no preference.

has_vegetarian_options.description: Flag indicating whether the restaurant offers vegetarian options.

has_seating_outdoors.description: Flag indicating whether the restaurant provides outdoor seating.

explanation: The user prompt is clear with specific details: the amount ($150), recipient (Alice), payment method (debit card), and privacy of the transaction (private). The function 'Payment_1_MakePayment' has parameters that directly correspond to the provided information, and the parameter descriptions are specific enough to execute the function without ambiguity. The function call can be uniquely determined with the provided details: Payment_1_MakePayment(payment_method='debit card', amount=150.0, receiver='Alice', private_visibility=True). No human re-evaluation is necessary.

question.content: Can you assist me in sending $150 to Alice using my debit card? Keep the transaction private.

function.name: Payment_1_RequestPayment
function.description: This function initiates a payment request to a specified receiver for a certain amount. It allows setting the visibility of the transaction to private or public.

receiver.description: The name or identifier of the contact or account to which the payment request is sent.

amount.description: The monetary value to be requested, specified in dollars.

private_visibility.description: Indicates if the transaction should be hidden from public transaction feeds. When set to true, the transaction is private.

function.name: Payment_1_MakePayment
function.description: Initiate a transaction to send a specified amount of money to a friend or contact using a chosen payment method.

payment_method.description: The payment source to use for the transaction, such as a balance within the app or a linked bank card.

amount.description: The monetary value to send, specified in the currency used by the payment platform.

receiver.description: The identifier of the contact or account to receive the payment. This could be a username, phone number, or email address.

private_visibility.description: A flag indicating whether the transaction should be hidden from public transaction feeds.

function.name: Restaurants_2_ReserveRestaurant
function.description: Make a table reservation at a restaurant. The function allows specifying the restaurant name, location, reservation time, number of seats, and date.

restaurant_name.description: The name of the restaurant for the reservation.

location.description: The location of the restaurant, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Berkeley, CA' or 'New York, NY'.

time.description: The tentative time of the reservation, in 24-hour format 'HH:MM'.

number_of_seats.description: The number of seats to reserve at the restaurant.

date.description: The tentative date of the restaurant reservation, in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. If not specified, the default value represents the current date.

function.name: Restaurants_2_FindRestaurants
function.description: Find restaurants based on specified location, cuisine category, and other optional preferences.

category.description: The cuisine type or category of food offered by the restaurant.

location.description: The city and state where the restaurant is located, in the format of 'City, State', such as 'Berkeley, CA' or 'New York, NY'.

price_range.description: The expected price range for dining at the restaurant.

has_vegetarian_options.description: Indicates if the restaurant offers adequate vegetarian options.

has_seating_outdoors.description: Indicates if the restaurant has outdoor seating available.
